revised_title: Anatomical Analysis of a 300-Year-Old Preserved Body Found in St. Edmund's-Bury Abbey
tldr: The discovery of a well-preserved body in St. Edmund's-Bury Abbey raises questions about the factors contributing to its preservation. The body, believed to be that of Thomas Beaufort, Duke of Exeter, was found in a leaden coffin and wrapped in cere-cloth. The author examines the condition of the body and considers the role of the cere-cloth, the lead coffin, and other factors in preserving the remains. The article discusses the potential role of natural causes and the art of embalming in such preservation.
